meanings.definition: To categorize or differentiate based on race.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was racializing the students by separating them into groups based on their skin color.
meanings.sent2: The media often racializes crime by focusing on the race of the suspects.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the players were racializing each other's abilities, but it was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The artist's use of color in the painting was racializing the emotions of the characters.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was so powerful that it was racializing the entire audience.

meanings.definition: To attribute racial characteristics to something.
meanings.sent1: She was racializing the doll by giving it features that represented a specific race.
meanings.sent2: Some people racialize certain foods, associating them with particular ethnic groups.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was racializing inanimate objects in his stand-up routine, much to the audience's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The author was racializing the landscape in the novel, using vivid descriptions to highlight racial undertones.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer was racializing the runway with a collection inspired by diverse cultural influences.
